intro: Diplusodon astictus, commonly known as the black thorn. It is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae, native to southern Africa. The plant is characterized by its dark, spiny stems and leaves, which serve as a defense mechanism against herbivores. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in complex inflorescences. The plant is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
